Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Bodyguard \Bod"y*guard`\, n. 1. A guard or group of guards to protect or defend the person; a lifeguard. [1913 Webster]
2. Retinue; attendance; following. --Bp. Porteus. [1913 Webster]
body guard v : accompany and protect from physical harm
bodyguard n 1: someone who escorts and protects a prominent person [syn: {escort}] 2: a group of men who escort and protect some important person [syn: {guard}]
